CoinDesk Validator 'Zelda' successfully exits Ethereum after withdrawal queue shrinks to 9 days. Queue peaked at 17 days, indicating reduced demand for validator removal.

title: CoinFund's new product could set the benchmark yield rate for Web3 - The Block
summary: CoinFund launches new product to set benchmark yield rate for Web3, CESR aims to provide clear and comparable metric for investors, sponsored by CleanSpark.

title: BNB Chain had over 10M active addresses in April; Ethereum had 4.9M - CryptoSlate
summary: BNB Chain had 10.9 million active addresses in April, the highest number, despite a 11% drop from March. Solana had 5.1 million active addresses, less than half the number of BNB chain. Ethereum had 4.9 million active addresses, down 7.9% from March. Other chains saw significant growth, including Avalanche, Celo, and Optimism. On the BNB chain, three platforms saw significant growth in users, including Polyhedra Network, LayerZero Labs, and Stargate. On Solana, new users are flocking to decentralized exchanges, lifestyle apps, and automated market makers.

title: New “Ethereum Killer” SUI Launches Today, What You Need To Know - NewsBTC
summary:
Sure! Here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

New blockchain SUI launches today, with high expectations due to its fast processing speed (300,000 tps) and low latency (450 milliseconds). SUI has a unique architecture and is backed by notable investors like Circle, Binance Labs, and Electric Capital. The token supply is capped at 10 billion, and it has multiple uses in the Sui economy, including participating in the proof-of-stake mechanism, paying gas fees, and supporting the economy. Listings on major exchanges like Binance are expected soon.

title: Ethereum's high gas fees see users flock to EVM-compatible chains - The Block
summary:
Sure! Here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Ethereum's high gas fees have led to a surge in usage of EVM-compatible chains, with daily new unique addresses peaking at 6.77 million last week. This is a new record, eclipsing the previous high of 6.74 million in 2021. Growth in these chains can be seen as a proxy for interest in an Ethereum-like user experience on-chain. BNB Chain and Polygon are leading the way, with increased usage due to their growing ecosystems. Ethereum Layer 2 networks, such as Optimism and Arbitrum, are also seeing increased usage.

title: What is the Total Ethereum Burned? - Watcher Guru
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Total Ethereum burned: 3,170,487.19 ETH, worth over $9.4 billion. Burn rate increased since EIP-115 upgrade. Merge event led to 547,196 ETH burned, worth over $861 million. Burn mechanism helps decrease circulating supply, increasing asset value.

title: Flare integrates blockchain API on Google Cloud Marketplace - Cointelegraph
summary: Flare, a layer-1 Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) blockchain platform, has integrated its API portal on Google Cloud Marketplace, offering high-integrity blockchain data to a large pool of developers and users. The integration provides blockchain APIs for various chains, including Algorand, BNB Smart Chain, Bitcoin, Dogecoin, Ethereum, Flare, Litecoin, Songbird, and XRP ledger, and future-supported blockchains. This makes it easier for developers to experiment with blockchain technology without the burden of hardware costs and ongoing maintenance. Flare's integration comes days after Polygon Labs and Google Cloud announced a multiyear partnership to boost the Ethereum scaling protocol's tools and infrastructure development.

title: DeFi Protocol Curve Finance Deploys Native Stablecoin on Ethereum Mainnet - CoinDesk
summary: Curve Finance, a DeFi protocol, has deployed its native stablecoin, crvUSD, on the Ethereum mainnet. The stablecoin is collateralized by a variety of assets, including stablecoins, and the protocol uses a dynamic liquidation mechanism to manage collateral ratio. If the price of the collateral assets falls below a certain level, the protocol will convert the assets into crvUSD, and later convert back to the collateral assets as the price recovers. This mechanism allows for automatic stabilization of the stablecoin's peg to the US dollar.

title: What is Vitalik Buterin's Net Worth? - Watcher Guru
summary: Vitalik Buterin, co-founder of Ethereum, has an estimated net worth of around $540 million as of 2023, according to Data Wallet. Buterin's net worth is based on various assets held in three wallets, including $500 million in on-chain assets and an additional $40 million in off-chain assets. However, Buterin has stated that he is not exponentially wealthy and donates most of his income to philanthropic causes. He has donated large amounts of cryptocurrency in the past, including 50 trillion Shiba Inu in 2021 and $9.4 million to the University of Maryland in 2022.

title: New Cosmos chain will use liquid staking tokens from other networks for security - Cointelegraph
summary:
Sure! Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

A new Cosmos-based blockchain called Tenet will use liquid staking tokens from other networks for security. The network will allow users to restake their liquid staking derivatives (LSDs) for additional rewards. The team expects this to provide long-term security and bring liquidity and yield opportunities to LSDs. The network will initially support Ether, BNB, Cosmos, Solana, and Polygon liquid staking derivatives. The development team includes former executives from Ankr and Blockdaemon, and the project is advised by members of the Lido, Ankr, and OpenAI teams. Liquid staking protocols have grown in popularity in recent years, and some experts believe the Ethereum Shanghai upgrade may further boost their growth.

title: Solana Surpasses Ethereum In Most On-Chain Active Addresses - ZyCrypto
summary: Solana has surpassed Ethereum in terms of the most on-chain active addresses, with 5.1 million active addresses in April compared to Ethereum's 4.9 million. Solana also outdid Ethereum in non-vote transactions, with 24.3 million compared to 974,972. The growth of Solana can be attributed to its attractive transaction speeds and costs, as well as the popularity of NFTs on the network. Recently, a new project called Mad Lads generated $17 million in trading volume on Solana, despite the network facing a setback from the exit of two popular collections earlier this year. Solana's native token SOL has also performed well, soaring by over 116% since January 1.

title: A guide on how to bridge from Solana to Ethereum - CNBCTV18
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Blockchain bridges allow transfer of assets between different blockchain networks, enabling interoperability and increasing access to decentralized applications. Cross-chain bridges create "wrapped" versions of assets that can be transferred to another blockchain.

For transferring assets from Solana to Ethereum, two popular options are Allbridge and Portal Bridge. Allbridge facilitates transfers between EVM networks and non-EVM chains, while Portal Bridge is a popular option for moving assets between Solana and Ethereum. Centralized exchanges (CEX) are also an option for transferring assets between blockchains, but they require submitting personal details and undergoing KYC.

The article highlights the security risks associated with cross-chain bridge thefts and the importance of weighing the options before choosing any bridge.

title: Solana's Phantom Wallet Goes Multichain, Overhauls NFTs - DailyCoin
summary:
Sure, here's a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Phantom Wallet, a Solana-based self-custodial wallet, has expanded its support to include Ethereum and Polygon networks, making it a multichain wallet. This upgrade allows users to manage their NFTs and tokens across different chains without switching wallets. Phantom aims to make itself more versatile and user-friendly, especially for NFT users. The wallet has also added new features for NFT management and enhanced security. Solana is betting that Phantom's growing market share will bring more users to its network.

summary:

Meanwhile, Collateral Network (COLT) is seeing excellent results and returns, with experts predicting 35x returns over the next quarter. The platform uses smart contracts to make the transaction seamless, private, and transparent.

While ICP's ETH integration is still in development, COLT is proving to be one of the most profitable crypto projects on the market.

title: Building the Future: Ethereum's Role in Web3 Development and its Impact on the Crypto Market - Finbold - Finance in Bold
summary:
Ethereum is a decentralized blockchain platform that enables developers to build and deploy decentralized applications (dApps). It has a large market capitalization and is the second-largest cryptocurrency by market capitalization, after Bitcoin. Ethereum's importance lies in its ability to enable complex smart contracts, DeFi applications, and NFTs. The price of Ethereum has significant implications for the broader crypto market and developer ecosystem, and understanding the factors that influence its price is crucial for developers.

Ethereum's role in Web3 development is significant, as it allows for the creation of decentralized applications and enables the next generation of the internet. Ethereum's technological advancements, such as Ethereum 2.0 and layer 2 solutions, can increase scalability and reduce transaction fees, leading to higher adoption of Ethereum-based applications. Market sentiment and speculation can also affect Ethereum's price, as positive news events and increased institutional adoption can lead to higher demand and prices.

title: Bitcoin and Ethereum liquidity is flowing into meme coins - The Coin Republic
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

Meme coins, such as Dogecoin and Shiba Inu, are gaining popularity and taking away liquidity from established cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and Ethereum. An anonymous trader, Crypto Tony, tweeted that this is why there is a "Sell in May" phenomenon, as meme coins perform better during this time. Pepe coin is currently experiencing a 2300% rally daily, with over 75,000 holders and $5 million in tokens. However, some traders are selling off due to lack of liquidity, with one trader losing $350,000. The trader is waiting for a long position entry on Bitcoin and expects Dogecoin to increase in value after new laws are introduced.

title: The SUI network and token are finally a reality: we are ready to revolutionize the crypto world. - The Cryptonomist
summary:
Here is a summary of the article in less than 256 tokens:

The SUI network and token are finally a reality, set to revolutionize the crypto world. Mysten Labs, the parent company, has raised $300 million and reached a valuation of $2 billion. The SUI network will operate on a proof-of-stake consensus mechanism, allowing for faster and more efficient transactions. It will also be interoperable, allowing for asset transfer between different blockchain networks. The SUI token is the native cryptocurrency and will be used for transaction fees, governance, and incentivizing users. The network has potential to become the leading platform for NFTs and gaming due to its innovative programming language, Move, which is more intuitive and easier to use. Move ensures security and fairness of smart contracts and is more efficient than other programming languages used in blockchain technology. The success of the SUI network and token will depend on time and adoption.
